summary: I mean, sure, Doctor Strange has a great effect on people (He’s used to it). And I would totally become sensitive (aka crying,...
body:
This

Finally turned back to normal.

Um… Okay Tumblr?

I mean, sure, Doctor Strange has a great effect on people (He’s used to it). And I would totally become sensitive (aka crying, just, just a little bit) if I saw him being awesome like that.

blog.name: dailybernthal
blog.title: Jon Bernthal Daily
blog.description:
Daily Bernthal is currently the most active blog dedicated to actor Jon Bernthal! He is best known for his roles as Frank Castle in Marvel's Cinematic Universe and Shane Walsh in AMC's hit show The Walking Dead. Here you will find your daily dose of everything Jon Bernthal related. Thank you for visiting and come back for daily updates on the latest news, photos, videos, and more!

We are currently accepting members and affiliates! Apply HERE.
We track #dailybernthal and #jonbernthaledit.

We are NOT spoiler-free.

summary: Hiii! Have you ever thought of having a crossover between the PJO universe and Marvel? Because Stuckony is just basically...
question: Hiii! Have you ever thought of having a crossover between the PJO universe and Marvel? Because Stuckony is just basically JasonxNicoxPercy. Jason is Steve, Nico is Bucky and Percy is Tony.
answer:
Hello! :3

There’s a certain appeal in making the Avengers demigods - like Clint a son of Apollo and Tony a son of Hephaestus and such. But as you might have noticed by my one Marvel fic, I’m not yet much of a Marvel writer.

And even I do actually need a plot to write a fic. Just “make em demigods” is definitely not enough to make me write a story. Even with all other crossovers, I had some Big Bad and actual quest plots in mind when I set out to making them demigods.

This would just be self-indulgent demigod stuff without a plot.

If I’d ever have an actual proper plot for a crossover, I will write but. But even then, it’s most definitely not going to be Stuck0ny, because I don’t really ship that - St/cky is a NOTP for me and the MCU ruined St0ny.

Now, that aside, I really don’t see the parallel you’re drawing there.

Tony and Percy don’t really have a lot in common. Tony and Leo, that you could make a case for. Yeah, the self-sacrificial tinkerers who can do better with machines than humans.

Steve and Jason…? Not really. Jason would be Thor. Not just because of the obvious - blonde, wielding lightning, flying, son of a king. Also because Asgardians work well as an analogy to Romans, “sure there’s tales of them but they’re not reeeaaal”, followed by them suddenly dropping in, with additional parallels of Loki and Octavian (manipulative, cunning, thinks he should be the rightful ruler instead).

And Nico and Bucky have… nothing in common, aside from being out of their time. Now, Nico and Batman that’s an analogy I’d buy.
